name: notself
text: I love that song. God help me, I love that song.

name: spectre
text: Me too. And the video. Anybody gotta problem with that, I will hella kick their ass.

name: twotonturkey
text: I love it so much that I have the picture disc vinyl single of the song.  The record is shaped like the African continent.  Someday I hope to have it framed.

name: intelligentblue
text:
who CAN'T love that song?

besides deaf people, i mean...

name: farqussus
text: i dunno, it's got a wicked bassline. Deaf can appreciate.

name: sweetlips
text: Who CAN'T love Ray. Just look at him.

name: doctorbeene
text: Even deaf people. They just feel it in their souls.

name: greyfield
text: Or you can take a deaf person, put them in front of a large speaker, and play this song. Though they cannot hear the notes, they will know everything is alright in the world.

name: greenkoolayd
text: but everything is not alright in the world.  especially not in africa.

name: epicurus
text: how dare you

name: soup_alex
text: It's mostly high-wavelength (low-frequency) soundwaves that humans perceive as physical vibrations as well as sound.

name: deimosrising
text: If you have not heard Toto I understand why this strip does not cause you to hemorrhage from laughter. If you have, for shame

name: suprememongoose
text: Hilarious!

name: magnumt
text: Whenever I hear Toto now I think of a dancing cat in a thong.

name: mortshire
text: then his work is done.

name: straw
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: brycemidas
text: I couldn't figure out why this post had no chubbies until I realized it was only posted yesterday. Kudos.

name: possums
text: Welp. Here it is. The most important gif ever.

name: ghostd
text: I understand if Ray can't help but bless the rains, down in afffricaaaa.

name: jrpigman
text: Honestly, theres nothing that a hundred men or more could ever do.

name: farqussus
text: so, everything has to be done by ninety-nine men at the most?

name: landowmpg
text: I didn't know what song this was referring to until you said that.  Thanks!

name: hellofyellin
text: Dancing cat, in the proud tradition of such as Hobbes.  God bless you Bill Watterson.  God bless you Chris Onstad.

name: i_love_kate
text: A comment left by i_love_kate was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by phthoggos, hellofyellin, VictoriaW)

name: i_love_kate
text: Thank you, three lamers. That made no sense whatsoever in the context.

name: woodenteeth
text: ... and yet I saw where you were going. Be it somewhat of a low bow to draw.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Everybody dance like there's Africa in your pants. (Picture that one and stay fashionable!)

name: deancain29
text: A comment left by deancain29 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Cyberbob, vermy, hooraybacon)

name: zedpower
text: Achewood caused wee to come out of you, onto the ground!

name: deancain29
text: down the leg and on the ground, dude. I enjoyed it. Does that make me bad?

name: jollysaintpete
text:
it makes me laugh that this comment has a lame because i just want to believe someone read it and like shivered and frowned before thinking to themselves, "that's so inappropriate" and laming it.

how do sensitive people enjoy achewood?

"time for my man-douche, hoss"

name: twohundredninety
text:
I hadn't heard this song when I first read this strip.

Now I have, and it is totally getting a five.

name: djwhiterabbit
text: A comment left by djwhiterabbit was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by austinceltic, riotdejaneiro, Cyberbob, snowman, Micrphonist, farqussus, GoriasXY, VictoriaW, Teabag_Mel)

name: tombsgrave
text: EXTERMINATE ANNIHILATE DESTROY

name: dovey
text: Yeah, nah.

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: There was this terrible a capella band called the Testostotones in my high school who would perform at all the talent shows, assemblies, etc. and in the 4 years I was exposed to them only once did they not sing Africa.  I went back and forth between feeling this complete absurdity redeemed them or made them even more hateful to my insides.

name: littlefatdog
text: our male a capella group was called the testostertones ! they all had balls but who cared in those days

name: zem
text: why- why would they not have balls

name: scorpio_nadir
text: At his kindergarten school.

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: Also the video is probably the greatest thing ever made.

name: straw
text: I was hoping very much that it was a video of that highschool acapella band

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: Alas, if I had that, I'd never need youtube again.

name: ovenface
text: sifl and olly! wow!

name: spectre
text: Hella Ernest Hemingway, all Somerset Maugham and a foam of Kipling.

name: platnmplus
text:
Looks like that video is down... but I was just checking in anyone had posted this already:

What an a capella choir singing "Africa" should sound like

Man, the thunder trick in the beginning frickin' ROCKS!

name: tombsgrave
text: In my mind it's the version of "Africa" from John Dies at the End.

name: sharpdresseddan
text: Thank God! Someone else who has read the best novel in the last five years!

name: jollysaintpete
text: Man, I loved John Dies at the End, and I even bought the book when it came out, but calling it the best novel in the last five years is silly

name: sharpdresseddan
text: Well, the best novel I've read in the last five years. I admit that was foolish of me to say, but now there is a new question: How will the movie do next year?

name: coconutjohn
text: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dt1fB62cGbo

name: cthulhu235
text: Awesome, completely awesome. I have a framed/signed copy of this strip hanging behind the desk in my office.

name: dasilodavi
text:
I get the feeling that Onstad is under the panel, slowly holding up the album.

Also, who else keeps thinking this song is by Duran Duran, despite numerous reminders? It can't be just me.

name: tekende
text: What? This song sounds nothing like Duran Duran.

name: kolchak
text: Hands down favourite strip, the one that originally got me into Achewood. I can't believe it's been more than 5 years now.

name: aurorasbored
text: Genius all over.

name: pez
text: frightened of this thing i had become! (ray dances slow mo)

name: 3v1l_1337
text:
this gets a 5, as sure as Kilimanjaro rises like Olympus above the Serengeti

sorry....couldn't resist

name: orvel
text: Panel 3 occurs at exactly 2:57 in the [url=]music video[/url].

name: orvel
text: Lame away, friends. I fixed it below.

name: orvel
text: Panel 3 occurs at exactly 2:57 in the music video .

name: hurfusdurfus
text: I'm thinking the whole strip takes place during that solo at 2:51.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Eh, ever since I first read this strip years ago I pictured it as happening during the climax of the song, from roughly 3:30 - 4:00, when the "soulful" back up singer comes in on the chorus.

name: the_dude
text: i didnt know stephen king could play the drums! (watch the video)

name: aparrish
text: Stephen King dressed in drag as Jane Fonda from 9 to 5 , no less.

name: zem
text: ahahaha that guy with the glasses fucking kills me every time they show his face

name: dr_strangeglove
text:
I have to tell you people about my night.

I got high with a beautiful girl in the back of her car. That right there is cause enough for celebration but, hold the phone!


she puts on this song. I'm being completely sincere when I say that I can't remember the last time I was that enamored with someone. Anyways, I'm on cloud 9 right now. I love everyone.

name: foea
text: Man, I hope the rest of that story stays awesome.

name: dr_strangeglove
text:
damn, that was 5 months ago already.

Long story short, we had a really great summer together and now she's moving 7 hours away. It's not the best situation, but it was one of the greatest summers of my life, so I'm in no position to complain.

I hope that was awesome enough.

name: heccibiggs
text: Awww.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: indeed

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
alternatively:

it is fifteen months since you wrote that, strangelove. i hope you've made at least one trip to see her since.

or was this always part of the plan?

name: leftsaidtim
text: WHY FIND OUT

name: sonofkong
text: DID SHE PUT UP A FIGHT?

name: quantumcasaba
text: This is wonderful. I forgot how much it made me laugh

name: johnnyrocker
text: RAY IS A MAN WHO DIGS LIFE.

name: howl
text: I have this strip to thank for introducing me to 80s music. One of the best gifts I have ever recieved.

name: zem
text: you just never heard of any 80s music before this strip, huh? they just took a break between 79 and 90?

name: howl
text: weeeeellll... yeah, pretty much, unless you count early TMBG. Mostly I was getting my knowledge from the radio. Needless to say, I hadn't heard of very much. Now the Pet Shop Boys are in my top ten bands.

name: howl
text: Indeed, everybody loves this song.

name: heyitschristian
text: no one should not hear this album.

name: woodenteeth
text: Damn it. I have to say it, just in case someone else out there is feeling as alone as I am. I really, really despise the saccharine, over-produced insincerity of this song. It's just an opinion. I know I have a problem. Look at all of you posting, saying I have a problem.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
austinceltic and cyberbob : it was cold of you to lame this man, who was feeling alone. He already knew he had a problem.

Have you never questioned the sincerity of a pop song?

name: woodenteeth
text: *sobs on fineoakstructure's arm*

name: fineoakstructure
text: There there, woodenteeth.  Emotions.

name: cyberbob
text: Of course I have.. but some songs are absolutely unquestionable.

name: heccibiggs
text: Oh Jesus this song came on at the party I was at last night, so fucking great.

name: snorestorm
text: Look at the freedom that Ray feels as he listens to this song!  You go, Ray!

name: 1000hz
text: HURRY RAY, IT'S WAITING THERE FOR YOU.
